snippet: As voters call for fewer government cutbacks and more spending, investors are asking: How will it be paid for?
abstract: Voters across Europe are calling for fewer government cutbacks and more spending on public programs, but investors are asking how it will be paid for; option of raising money through bond sales appears to be shrinking as investors worry about the ability of euro zone nations to repay their loans; attention has shifted to the European Central Bank, which could issue more inexpensive loans to banks, but has shown no inclination to do so.

byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and JACK EWING

lead_paragraph: As voters call for fewer government cutbacks and more spending, investors are asking: How will it be paid for?

headline.main: Few Options if Europe Turns Away From Austerity
headline.print_headline: In Europe, A Dwindling Of Options
